name: p-nitrobenzamide
source: Beilstein F. K.; Beilsteins Handbuch der Organischen Chemie. Springer; Berlin; 1972.
Reason: The melting point of p-nitrobenzamide can be estimated by considering the melting point contributions of its functional groups. The basic unit, benzamide, has a melting point of around 130 degrees Celsius. The nitro group (-NO2) is a strong electron-withdrawing group that introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50 degrees Celsius. The amide group (-CONH-) is a polar group that can participate in hydrogen bonding, contributing about +30 degrees Celsius. Summing these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
